snippet: The decision potentially opens the way for the development of a shale gas industry in Western Europe.
abstract: British government approves exploratory hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, to extract gas from shale-rock deposits, opening door for industry to begin development in Western Europe; government has called for stringent controls to appease environmental concerns about controversial technique.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The decision potentially opens the way for the development of a shale gas industry in Western Europe.

headline.seo: Britain Approves Fracking for Shale Gas Exploration
headline.main: With Controls, Britain Allows Hydraulic Fracturing to Explore for Gas
headline.print_headline: With Controls, Britain Allows Hydraulic Fracturing to Explore for Gas
